executive_summary: Estate liquidation has done well, for a relatively small industry, and will continue to do so through the end of 2024. Industry revenue is expected to have grown at a CAGR of 2.1% through the end of 2024 to reach an estimated $230.3 million, despite an expected contraction of 0.4% in 2024. However, profit has shrunk from 17.2% of revenue in 2018 to an estimated 11.7% in 2024 because of mounting costs.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising Mortgage Rates Have Led to a Greater Supply
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Elevated inflation has driven up interest rates and therefore mortgage rates, creating an increase in home foreclosures. While this limits the number of potential clients frequenting estate liquidation sales, it has provided the industry with a larger catalog of estates to liquidate.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Industry Weathered the COVID-19 Pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: After 1 million US citizens died during the COVID-19 pandemic, a large amount of properties were left intestate and in need of liquidation. Accompanying the pandemic was a series of government stimulus checks that drove up discretionary spending. This created a favorable environment for estate liquidators, though growth was not seen until 2022.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: ESTATE LIQUIDATION SERVICES WILL CONTINUE TO GROW
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: High mortgage rates and an aging population will aid the estate liquidation industry through 2029. As more Americans reach retirement age consumer spending will rise, presenting the potential for industry growth. Increasing death rates are expected to boost the need for liquidation services, leading to increased revenue.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: TOUGH ECONOMIC CONDITIONS PRESENT BOTH CHALLENGE AND OPPORTUNITY
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Elevated inflation poses a direct threat to the estate liquidation industry. Poor economic conditions are a double-edged sword for the industry. Since they involve discretionary purchases, estate sales rely on consumers having a surplus of money to spend. However, increased inflation and mortgage rates generate more "products" for the liquidators to sell.

industry_definition: Estate liquidators are primarily engaged in one or more of the following activities: researching public land records to gather information relating to real estate; preparing documents necessary for title transfers, financing and settlement; administering final real estate settlements and conducting closings; and filing legal and other documents relating to the sale of real

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level low - steady

key_trends: The industry has benefited from the COVID-19 pandemic. Increased death rates and urban flight led to a boom in demand for estate liquidation.
High mortgage rates have buoyed the industry since 2022. Rampant inflation has forced many families to sell their homes, driving the need for estate liquidation.
Aging demographics have helped the industry. The Baby Boomer generation has aged into retirement and has brought with it an abundance of discretionary funds.

High inflation has threatened downstream demand. After rapidly rising in 2021 and 2022, elevated inflation has hindered downstream demand to the point where most demographics have had to cut back on discretionary spending.
The industry relies on estate sales to acquire revenue. Estate sales vary in size and scale but are still the primary source of income for

market_segmentation.segment_description: Businesses and farms are the primary downstream market for the industry. They pursue estate liquidations to purchase bulk materials at a price lower than market value, such as furniture, livestock and structures.
Household consumers and individuals frequent estate sales to get a good deal on items they may need, such as antiques, vintage goods, clothing, furniture, and collectibles.

Federal and state governments purchase bulk goods from estate liquidation sales, including property for resale as surplus. This makes the government a competitor to the private estate liquidation industry.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Civil Law Services - Wills, Estates and Trusts
products_and_services.product_description: Companies that handle estate liquidation also typically offer a multitude of other legal services. Still, executing and managing the wills, estates and trusts of the deceased generate the most revenue for the industry.
Other Civil Law Services Include Titles and Settlements.
Arbitration provides a steady source of revenue for companies that deal in what can be considered day-to-day legal services. Arbitration mitigates the expenses incurred by drawn-out legal disputes.

tier_1_suppliers: Savings Banks & Thrifts in the US
tier_1_buyers: Savings Banks & Thrifts in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: People aged 65 or older are a key demographic for estate liquidators as the number of people in this age group is growing due to the aging Baby Boomer generation.
High mortgage rates increase foreclosures, providing more products for estate liquidators to sell.
Higher disposable income leads to more consumer spending, including on discretionary items sold at estate sales.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region has the highest percentage of both business establishments (around 30%) and population (around 25%).
The West region has the second-highest percentage of business establishments (around 20%) and population (around 22%).
The Mid-Atlantic region has a higher percentage of population (around 15%) compared to the percentage of business establishments (around 10%).
The New England region has a lower percentage of population (around 5%) compared to the percentage of business establishments (around 10%).
The Plains region has relatively lower percentages of both business establishments and population compared to other regions.
The Rocky Mountains region has relatively lower percentages of both business establishments and population compared to other regions.
The Southwest region has relatively lower percentages of both business establishments and population compared to other regions.

basis_points.basis_description: Providers compete locally to mediate auctions. A liquidator's revenue is a percentage of all sales made in a given auction, so the quantity and quality of goods are both important.
Hiring and maintaining a viable workforce is the steepest challenge for prospective liquidators. Wages are the industry's most significant expense.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: PROFIT HAS BEEN STYMIED IN THE FACE OF ECONOMIC TURMOIL
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Estate liquidators' profit is expected to have steadily shrunk through the end of 2023 because of diminished per capita disposable income caused by the economic recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic.

Rent is the second-largest single expense for estate liquidators. Most liquidators rent office space. The size of these spaces varies from large to small. The on-demand nature of the business means income can be volatile, meaning rent is a constant concern for liquidators.

Wages are the largest expense for estate liquidators. However, wages do not take into account nonemployers. Estate liquidators make a commission on each item sold at an estate sale, meaning there is a loose correlation between wage growth and industry revenue.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The Industry is Susceptible to Macroeconomic Conditions
volatility_points.volatility_description: Industry performance fluctuates inversely to economic trends that impact consumers.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: WILLS, ESTATES AND TRUSTS ARE THE INDUSTRY'S PRIMARY OFFERING
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Companies that handle estate liquidation also typically offer a multitude of other legal services.

FAQs.question: What are the major players in this industry?
FAQs.answer: There are no major players in this industry.

FAQs.question: What are the key cost components and their benchmarks for 2024?
FAQs.answer: The key cost components as a percentage of revenue for 2024 are: Profit 0%, Wages 10%, Purchases 20%, Depreciation 30%, Marketing 40%, Rent 50%, Utilities 60%, Other 70%.
